analytic.author: Rowley, William

monogr.title: The tragedy of the Dutchesse of Malfy : As it was presented priuatly, at the Black-Friers; and publiquely at the Globe, by the Kings Maiesties Seruants. The perfect and exact coppy, with diuerse things printed, that the length of the play would not beare in the presentment. VVritten by Iohn Webster
monogr.author: Webster, John

div.head: To his friend Mr. Iohn Webster Vpon his Dutchesse of Malfy.
div.l: I Neuer saw thy Dutchesse, till the day,
That She was liuely body'd in thy Play;
How'ere she answer'd her low rated Loue,
Her brothers anger, did so far all prooue,
But (neuer in her life) so well before.
